title: Warm Strawberry Apple Skillet Crumble with Honey Yogurt Drizzle
directions: Cook the fruit: In a small skillet over medium heat, add a bit of butter/oil. Toss in the apple first with a tiny splash of water, a pinch of cinnamon and salt. After 2-3 minutes, add strawberries and 1-2 tsp honey. Cook until soft and syrupy, about 5-7 minutes total.

Make the crumble: In the same pan or a separate one, mix 1 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp flour or oats, and 2 tbsp brown sugar. Stir until golden and smells like cookies. Optionally add salt, cinnamon, or chocolate chips.
Plate and serve: Spoon the warm fruit into a bowl. Top with the crumble.
Mix Greek yogurt with a touch of honey and drizzle over the top. Warm the yogurt slightly if you want it more sauce-like.
notes: For a chocolate version: stir chocolate chips into the warm fruit right after removing from heat, mix cocoa powder into the crumble, or stir melted chocolate/Nutella into the yogurt drizzle. Optional twists: add chopped nuts to the crumble, mix vanilla extract or lemon zest into the fruit while cooking.
